titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT NOBLE AND VER∣tuous Lord, Henry Earle of Southampton.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT NOBLE AND VER∣tuous Lord, Henry Earle of Southampton.

monogr.title: Parthenophil and Parthenophe : Sonnettes, madrigals, elegies and odes. To the right noble and vertuous gentleman, M. William Percy Esquier, his deerest friend
monogr.author: Barnes, Barnabe

div.head: TO THE RIGHT NOBLE AND VERtuous Lord, Henry Earle of Southampton.

lg.l: Receaue (sweet Lord) with thy thrise-sacred hande
Which sacre •… muses make their instrument,
These worthlesse leaues, which I to thee present
Sprong from a rude and vnmanured lande:
That with your countenance grac'de, they may withstande
To scorne back-wounding Zoilus his bande.
Voutch-safe (right vertuous Lord) with gracious eyes
Those heauenly lampes, which giue the muses light,
Which giue, and take in course (that holy fier)
To vewe my muse with your iudiciall sight,
Whom when time shall haue taught by flight to rise,
Shall to thy vertues of much worth aspyer.
